captions.text: It's not a joke.

Everyone asks what are you doing?
What's the point?

You're drifting, playing
in the streets,
you're driving around a cone.

The money you spend on your car
is going to waste.

They say we're playing and damaging
our cars and tires.
People look down their noses at us.

It's not about a bunch of kids
playing around.

Drifting means to control the car
in certain narrow areas,

moving the car to the left, to the right,
or back to how it was.
It's not easy, we work hard on our cars.

We work on our cars for six
or seven months,
waiting a whole year for just one event.
This sport has become famous worldwide,
in Egypt and abroad.

Haitham and I participated
with one car because we had a problem.
We had to compete as a team,

because my car, on the day
before the competition,
had an unexpected electrical problem.

So we had to leave
long gaps between our turns,
so that the car would cool down.

The only difference is that I was
the first car to enter the race.

We normally like to watch
other cars first,
to see what they will do.

The car seat is narrow,
so it wasn't comfortable.
And the hydraulic handbrake is right here.
In my car it's on the right side,

but Haitham put it there
because he's thin.
In the first round I was speeding a little,
so the car got hit and I got nervous.
In the first heat,
I used the red smoke.
People were so happy
and excited.
The track was impressive,
the fact that it was two levels,
made it a different experience.
Suddenly the car shut down,

and it stopped, I looked at the RPM gauge
and the lights were off.

Haitham was standing down there,
looking at the screens,

he told me that once he saw it stopping,
he knew it broke down.

But once I shifted gears,
it started again.

and I told her, "come on!
let's finish quickly!"
I was talking to the car while driving it.
In the second heat,
while heading to the box, I hit the cone,
And it moved in front of the car.
I said "come here!"

Every time I started a heat,
Haitham got stressed.

If the car broke down,
both of us would be out.
I performed well on the track,
but the car stopped before the last order.

In 2011, during the third round,
I did quite well.

And before the last order,
the car went into the safe mode,

so the engine wouldn’t get damaged,
so it just stopped.

I couldn't believe that 
the same scenario was recurring.

I saw Dado coming to push the car
out of the track.

I kept looking at the car
and the audience in disbelief.
And people were cheering for me again,
trying to encourage me to go on,

while I was considering
giving up drifting,
and thinking that this game is not for me.
For me, to represent Egypt in Dubai
is a big deal.
When I started,
I didn’t expect to reach the podium,
because I didn't have my car.
I expected a mechanical failure to happen.

I didn’t imagine I could win,
I never dreamed of this.

Haitham and I still wonder
how this car didn’t break down.

For it to complete ten rounds,
is an achievement.
